info.title: Workato API (params in:body)
info.description:
Workato REST API provides access the Workato resources. You can manage recipes, connections and jobs programmatically using API. API also allows you to author new recipes and modify existing recipes.

Authentication¶ ↑

All API requests must provide user_token & user_email in query parameters or in request headers. The user_token is provided in your settings page.

get.description: Get details of a job

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

is_poll_error.description: Returns true if an error occurred in the trigger while polling, otherwise returns false

error.description: Contains job title or job error when there is an error. Otherwise, it returns null.

is_error.description: Returns true if the job has an error, otherwise returns false

lines.description: Details of each line in the recipe

is_repeat.description: Returns true if the job is a repeat of another job

is_test.description: Returns true if the job is a test job

is_test_case_job.description: Returns true if the job is a test case job

calling_recipe_id.description: Calling recipe ID. Available if this recipe is called by a parent recipe.

calling_job_id.description: Calling job ID. Available if this recipe is created by a called recipe.

calling_job_handle.description: Calling job handle. Available if this recipe is called by a parent recipe.

get.description: Returns aggregated job information as well as detailed job information for a specified recipe in Workato.

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

parameters.name: offset_job_id
parameters.description: Offset job ID or job rerun ID

parameters.name: prev
parameters.description: Defaults to false. When prev=false, this call returns jobs completed prior to the offset_job_id. If prev=true, jobs newer than the offset_job_id are returned.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status - succeeded, failed or pending

parameters.name: rerun_only
parameters.description: If true, returns jobs that were rerun only

job_scope_count.description: Number of jobs matching the given criteria

download_url.description: Package download URL if completed, null otherwise

recipe_status.description: Id and Import status updated recipes for package

post.summary: Export package based on the manifest.

download_url.description: Package download URL if completed, null otherwise

post.summary: Import a package into the folder
post.description:
Import a package (zip file) into the folder. Input is a "application/octet-stream" payload containg a package content.
    `restart_recipes` should be "true" in order to restart running recipes.

restart_recipes.description: Set 'true' to allow restarting of the running recipes

download_url.description: Package download URL if completed, null otherwise

get.description: Redirects to package content or returns 404 if package not found or doesn't have content
List all API collections. The endpoint returns the project_id of the project to which the collections belong in the response.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API collections to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the API collections to fetch. Defaults to 1.

post.description: Create an API collection within a project you specify

project_id.description: The ID of a specific project. Retrieve a list of project IDs using the list projects endpoint.

get.description: Returns a list of lookup tables belonging to customer account. Workato includes the project_id of the project to which the lookup table belongs in the response.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the lookup tables to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of lookup tables to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

post.description: Create a new lookup table. Depending on your requirements, you can choose to make the lookup table available for general access across your workspace or limit its scope to a specific project.

get.description: Get a row from the lookup table

put.description: Updates a row in the lookup table

data.description: The hash containing the data for the updated row in the form of column_name:value pairs. For example, { "name": "United States", "code": "USA" }. Only the columns provided are updated.

200.description: Success reply. Also returns an error message on failures in this format { "error": "error_message" }

delete.description: Delete a row from the lookup table

200.description: Success reply. Also returns an error message on failures in this format { "error": "error_message" }

get.description: Returns a lists of rows from the lookup table. Supports filtering and pagination.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the lookup table rows to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API clients to return in a single page. Defaults to 500. Max is 1000.

200.description: Success reply. Also returns an error message on failures in this format { "error": "error_message" }

post.description: Adds a row to the lookup table

data.description: The hash containing the data for the new row in the form of column_name:value pairs. For example, { "name": "United States", "code": "USA" }

200.description: Success reply. Also returns an error message on failures in this format { "error": "error_message" }

get.description: Finds the first row matching the given criteria in the lookup table. Returns a 404 when the lookup fails.

post.description: Use this endpoint to delete lookup tables in batch

ids.description: Include the ID(s) of the lookup table(s) you plan to delete

post.description: Retrieve messages from the topic. This resource provides the option to retrieve all messages within the topic or, by including parameters in the request body, to fetch messages after a specified ID or timestamp.

since_time.description: Read messages starting from this time

post.description: Publish a message to a topic. The message must comply with the topic schema.

get.summary: List access profiles belonging to an API client
get.description: List all access profiles belonging to an API client

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Choose the page of access profiles to return. The starting page is 1. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of access profiles returned in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

parameters.name: api_client_id
parameters.description: Provide an API client ID to retrieve access profiles belonging to a specific API client.

post.summary: Create an access profile belonging to an API client
post.description:
Create an access profile belonging to an API client. To use this endpoint, the account must contain at least 1 API collection to assign to the access profile.
    The response returned depends on the auth type chosen (Auth token, JSON web token or OAuth 2.0).

    1. Auth token authorization will return the auth token in the secret response
    2. JWT token has 2 signing methods: HMAC and RSA. Depending on the chosen method, the respective secret or public is required in the payload
    3. OAuth 2.0 authorization will return the client ID and secret in oauth_client_id and oauth_client secret

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of collections to add to the access profile

auth_type.description: Authentication method to validate requests. Available types are: token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. If the auth_type is jwt, this is required. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

active.description: Whether the access profile is disabled or enabled. A client with a disabled access profile cannot call any APIs.

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively. Only applicable if the auth_type is jwt.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

put.summary: Update an access profile belonging to an API client
put.description:
Update an access profile belonging to an API client.

    The response returned depends on the auth type chosen (Auth token, JSON web token or OAuth 2.0).

    1. Auth token authorization will return the auth token in the secret response
    2. JWT token has 2 signing methods: HMAC and RSA. Depending on the chosen method, the respective secret or public is required in the payload
    3. OAuth 2.0 authorization will return the client ID and secret in oauth_client_id and oauth_client secret

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of collections to add to the access profile

auth_type.description: Authentication method to validate requests. Available types are: token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. If the auth_type is jwt, this is required. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively. Only applicable if the auth_type is jwt.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

put.description: Enable an access profile belonging to an API client. Enabling an access profile will allow API calls to be accepted with the enabled profile.

result.description: Always returns success upon successful operation

put.description: Disable an access profile belonging to an API client. Disabling an access profile will stop allowing API calls to be accepted with the access profile.

result.description: Always returns success upon successful operation

put.summary: Refresh token secret or oauth client secret
put.description:
Refreshes the auth token or OAuth 2.0 client secret. This endpoint will fail if the authorization type on the access profile is JWT.

    The response returned depends on the authorization type of the access profile (Auth token or OAuth 2.0).

    1. Auth token authorization will return a new auth token in the secret response
    2. OAuth 2.0 authorization will return a new client ID and secret in oauth_client_id and oauth_client secret

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively. Only applicable if the auth_type is jwt.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

get.description: List custom OAuth profiles. Client secrets and tokens are never returned in the response.

parameters.description: Number of custom OAuth profiles to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

name.description: Name of the custom OAuth profile

provider.description: Name of the app tied to this custom OAuth profile

parameters.description: ID of the custom OAuth profile to retrieve

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the custom OAuth profile to update

name.description: Name of the custom OAuth profile

provider.description: Name of the app tied to this custom OAuth profile

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the custom OAuth profile to delete

force.description: When 'true' delete the custom OAuth profile even if it is used. Defaults to 'false'.

parameters.description: Parent folder ID. Defaults to Home folder.

parameters.description: Page number of the folders to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page

post.description: Creates a new folder in the specified parent folder. If no parent folder ID is specified, the folder created will be a top level folder (in the Home folder).

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder you plan to delete

force.description: Set this parameter to true to delete a folder that is not empty. When true, the folder you specify using the folder_id parameter, and its contents (all recipes and connections) within the folder are deleted. If set to false, this action can only delete an empty folder.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

put.summary: Update an access profile belonging to an API client
put.description:
Update an access profile belonging to an API client.

    The response returned depends on the auth type chosen (Auth token, JSON web token or OAuth 2.0).

    1. Auth token authorization will return the auth token in the secret response
    2. JWT token has 2 signing methods: HMAC and RSA. Depending on the chosen method, the respective secret or public is required in the payload
    3. OAuth 2.0 authorization will return the client ID and secret in oauth_client_id and oauth_client secret

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of collections to add to the access profile

auth_type.description: Authentication method to validate requests. Available types are: token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. If the auth_type is jwt, this is required. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively. Only applicable if the auth_type is jwt.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

put.description: Enable an access profile belonging to an API client. Enabling an access profile will allow API calls to be accepted with the enabled profile.

result.description: Always returns success upon successful operation

put.description: Disable an access profile belonging to an API client. Disabling an access profile will stop allowing API calls to be accepted with the access profile.

result.description: Always returns success upon successful operation

put.summary: Refresh token secret or oauth client secret
put.description:
Refreshes the auth token or OAuth 2.0 client secret. This endpoint will fail if the authorization type on the access profile is JWT.

    The response returned depends on the authorization type of the access profile (Auth token or OAuth 2.0).

    1. Auth token authorization will return a new auth token in the secret response
    2. OAuth 2.0 authorization will return a new client ID and secret in oauth_client_id and oauth_client secret

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

jwt_method.description: The JWT signing method. Available methods are hmac and rsa for HMAC and RSA respectively. Only applicable if the auth_type is jwt.

jwt_secret.description: Based on the method, specify the HMAC shared secret or the RSA public key

oidc_issuer.description: Discovery URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_jwks_uri, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

oidc_jwks_uri.description: JWKS URL of identity provider or OIDC service. Provide only one of this or oidc_issuer, not both. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

access_profile_claim.description: If you wish to use a custom claim to identify this access profile, provide the JWT claim key here. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

required_claims.description: Provide a list of claims that you wish to enforce. Only applicable if auth_type is jwt or oidc.

allowed_issuers.description: Provide a list of issuers (represented by the 'iss' value in JWT claims) that you wish to allow. If the 'iss' claim is enforced in 'required_claims', leave this field blank to accept any 'iss' value. This parameter is only applicable when 'auth_type' is set to 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

ip_allow_list.description: List of IP addresses to be allowlisted

get.description: Get a list of all customer accounts

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the Embedded customers to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of Embedded customers to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

post.description: Create a new Embedded customer

notification_email.description: Email for error and administrative notifications

external_id.description: External identifier for the Embedded customer

origin_url.description: Applies to Embedded account customers. Provide a value if the embedded IFrame is hosted in a non-default origin page. For example, customer specific custom domains. Defaults to the origin configured at the account level.

frame_ancestors.description: Provide one or more comma-separated frame ancestors. These URLs are used in the Content-Security-Policy HTTP header to allow rendering of Workato IFrames.

plan_id.description: Plan ID. Default plan is used when value is not provided.

time_zone.description: The name of the timezone of the user. Defaults to PST if not specified.

full_embedding.description: When set to true end users are sent to the customer account's origin_url. Set to false to turn off the fully embedded redirect process at the customer account level. If you do not specify this value it defaults to null and inherits this value (true or false) from the Embedded partner's admin settings.

get.description: Retrieve details about an Embedded customer's account

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

put.description: Updates the information for an existing Embedded customer's account

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

notification_email.description: Email for error and administrative notifications

admin_notification_emails.description: Emails for administrative notifications. This property overrides what you input in notification email property.

error_notification_emails.description: Emails for error notifications. This property overrides what you input in notification email property.

in_trial.description: Downgrade or upgrade the user to/from a free plan and subscription plan

task_limit_adjustment.description: Task limit adjustment for current accounting period. Only valid for task-based plans. This adjustment will not apply to subsequent periods. Make a negative adjustment by adding "-" (eg. "-5000").

billing_start_date.description: Set the current billing start date. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2021-12-31

external_id.description: External identifier for the Embedded customer

origin_url.description: Applies to Embedded account customers. Provide a value if the embedded IFrame is hosted in a non-default origin page. For example, customer specific custom domains. Defaults to the origin configured at the account level.

frame_ancestors.description: Provide one or more comma-separated frame ancestors. These URLs are used in the Content-Security-Policy HTTP header to allow rendering of Workato IFrames.

plan_id.description: Plan ID. Default plan is used when value is not provided.

time_zone.description: The name of the timezone of the user. Defaults to PST if not specified.

full_embedding.description: When set to true end users are sent to the customer account's origin_url. Set to false to turn off the fully embedded redirect process at the customer account level. If you do not specify this value it defaults to null and inherits this value (true or false) from the Embedded partner's admin settings.

external_id.description: External ID of the Embedded customer

admin_notification_emails.description: Comma-separated list of admin notification emails

error_notification_emails.description: Comma-separated list of error notification emails

plan_id.description: ID of the plan assigned to this customer

origin_url.description: Origin URL where the embedded IFrame is hosted

trial.description: Indicates if the customer account is in trial

in_trial.description: Indicates if the customer account is in trial

frame_ancestors.description: Comma-separated list of frame ancestor URLs

task_limit_adjustment.description: Task limit adjustment for current accounting period. Only valid for task-based plans.

active_connection_limit.description: Maximum active connections allowed for this customer

active_connection_count.description: Number of active connections in the customer's workspace

active_recipe_count.description: Number of running recipes in the customer's workspace

billing_start_date.description: Current billing start date. The returned date value will be in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2021-12-31

delete.description: Deletes an Embedded customer account. Once deleted, customer accounts aren't fully recoverable. Use caution when using this endpoint.

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

put.description: Upgrade Embedded customer account plan to OEM plan from trial or community plan

plan_id.description: Plan ID. Default plan is used when value is not provided.

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

put.summary: Update customer workspace's data retention period
put.description: Updates the data retention period for customer workspaces where the Configurable Data Retention add-on is enabled

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

data_retention_ttl_hours.description: The length of time to retain data for the specified customer workspace, in hours. The minimum data retention period is 1 hour and the maximum is determined by the Embedded customer's plan.

get.description: Get a list of monthly usage for all Embedded customers for the last 12 months. Task data is currently the only data available.

Returns a list of properties belonging to a customer account that matches a prefix. For example, if the prefix provided is salesforce_sync., any account property with a name beginning with 'salesforce_sync.' will be returned. Depending on the presence of the project_id, it returns either environment properties or project properties.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Return properties with the given prefix. E.g: 'salesforce_sync.'

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: If provided, returns only the project properties associated with the specified project

200.description: Returns a hash containing key-value pairs of matching properties

post.description: Performs an upsert operation on properties. The properties are matched based on the names provided in the request.

properties.description: Hash containing the names and values of the properties to upsert

project_id.description: Project where properties should be upserted

get.description: Get details of a package imported into a customer account

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

error.description: Error description if export operation failed

post.summary: Import package into a customer account
post.description: Import a package into a specified folder in a customer account

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

restart_recipes.description: Value must be 'true' to allow the restarting of running recipes during import. Packages cannot be imported if there are running recipes and this parameter equals 'false' or is not provided.

get.description: Find recipes of authenticated user with respect to different filters. Recipes are returned in descending ID order

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: adapter_names_all
parameters.description: List of adapters names. Resulting recipes should use all of given adapters

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Is flow running. 'true' - running, 'false' - stopped, all recipes otherwise

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Find recipes with ID less than given

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Return the recipes in the specified folder

parameters.name: stopped_after
parameters.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Set ordering method or default if blank. Possible options: activity

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Page size(defaults to 10. Max allowed is 100)

parameters.name: exclude_code
parameters.description: When 'true' the response will not contain the 'code' attribute

parameters.name: adapter_names_any
parameters.description: List of adapters names. Resulting recipes should use at least one of given adapters

get.description: This API returns a recipe object

post.summary: Forces a running recipe to poll immediately

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: OEM user account id/external id. External should be prefixed with a E(eg: EA2300) and the resulting id should be URL encoded.

parameters.description: OEM user account id/external id. External should be prefixed with a E(eg: EA2300) and the resulting id should be URL encoded.

force.description: When 'true' stops the recipe by terminating long running jobs. Defaults to 'false'.

parameters.name: applications
parameters.description: Comma separated connector identifiers(e.g: salesforce,service_now). Resulting recipes should use at least one of given connectors

parameters.name: boost_owned
parameters.description: Give higher priority to recipes in your account. Defaults to 'false'

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: OEM user account id/external id. External should be prefixed with a E(eg: EA2300) and the resulting id should be URL encoded.

parameters.description: ID of the custom OAuth profile within the Embedded partner workspace you plan to assign to a customer workspace.

get.description: Lists all API endpoints. Specify the api_collection_id to obtain the list of endpoints in a specific collection.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API endpoints to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

parameters.description: ID of the API collection. If the parameter is not provided, all API endpoints are returned.

Disables an active API endpoint. The endpoint can no longer be called by a client.

get.description: Retrieves all connections and associated data for the Embedded customer account. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The application type of the connection, e.g., 'salesforce'.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project or folder containing the connection

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: The ID of the parent connection, which must be of the same provider type.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The external ID assigned to the connection, typically given to the user who owns the connection.

parameters.name: include_runtime_connections
parameters.description: Includes all runtime user connections when set to 'true'

post.description:
Creates a connection in a customer's account. This endpoint supports the following in customer accounts:

1. Adding a shell connection, OR
2. Adding and authenticating a connection (not supported for OAuth type connections)

Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

parameters.name: managed_user_id
parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

provider.description: The application type of the connection, e.g., 'salesforce'.

name.description: Connection name. Eg: 'Prod Salesforce connection' etc.

folder_id.description: The ID of the project or folder where the connection should be stored

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent connection, which must be of the same provider type.

external_id.description: The external ID assigned to the connection, typically given to the user who owns the connection.

authorization_status.description: Authorization status of the connection, can be 'success', 'exception', or nil

external_id.description: External identifier for the user who owns the runtime user connection

folder_id.description: ID of the folder where the connection is stored

put.description: Updates a connection in a customer account. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

parameters.description: Embedded customer Account ID/External ID. External IDs should be prefixed with 'E' (e.g., 'EA2300') and URL-encoded.

name.description: Connection name. Eg: 'Prod Salesforce connection' etc.

folder_id.description: Folder id where connection should be stored.

external_id.description: External identifier given to the user who owns the runtime user connection.

authorization_status.description: Authorization status of the connection, can be 'success', 'exception', or nil

external_id.description: External identifier for the user who owns the runtime user connection

folder_id.description: ID of the folder where the connection is stored

delete.description: Deletes a disconnected connection in a customer account. Fails if connection is active or in use by active recipes. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

pick_list_params.description: Picklist parameters, required in some picklists. For more information view this https://docs.workato.com/oem/oem-api/picklist-parameters.html

result.description: An array of picklist field mappings. Each inner array contains two elements: the first is the picklist field name, and the second is the picklist field ID.

parameters.description: Number of projects to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

parameters.description: The ID of the project you plan to delete

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project ID. This parameter accepts a valid project_id or a valid folder_id, formatted as f{:folder_id}, for example: f660222.

environment_type.description: The environment the project will be deployed to. Accepted values: test, prod.

description.description: A brief description of the deployment.

project_build_id.description: ID of the associated project build

environment_type.description: The environment where the project is deployed

state.description: Status of the build. Possible values are: pending, success and failed.

performed_by_name.description: Name of the user who initiated the build

post.description: Builds a project. You can use this endpoint (/api/project_builds/:id/deploy) to deploy the project to an environment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project ID. This parameter accepts a valid project_id or a valid folder_id, formatted as f{:folder_id}, for example: f660222.

description.description: A brief description of the build

include_test_cases.description: Instructs the build to include test cases or not. Default: false

state.description: Status of the build. Possible values are: pending, success and failed.

performed_by_name.description: Name of the user who initiated the build

download_url.description: URL to download the package. Returns null, if the build is not complete.

get.description: List custom connectors in your Workspace

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Search for custom connectors by their titles. Partial matches will also be returned.

parameters.name: oem_shared
parameters.description: Search for custom connectors that are shared from your OEM master account. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege

post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a custom connector in your workspace

title.description: The title of the custom connector you plan to create

logo.description: The logo you plan to add to your custom connector. Your logo must be encoded in Base64 format.

description.description: A description of your custom connector. Markdown is allowed.

note.description: Notes for the initial version of your custom connector

code.description: The Ruby code for your custom connector. Ensure that the code is stringified. Your code cannot exceed 10MB in size.

get.description: Retrieve a specific custom connector by ID. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

put.description: This endpoint allows you to update a custom connector in your workspace

title.description: The title of the custom connector you plan to create

logo.description: The logo you plan to add to your custom connector. Your logo must be encoded in Base64 format.

description.description: A description of your custom connector. Markdown is allowed.

note.description: Notes for the initial version of your custom connector

code.description: The Ruby code for your custom connector. Ensure that the code is stringified. Your code cannot exceed 10MB in size.

post.summary: Upsert version of shared custom connector
post.description:
Creates or updates the version of a shared custom connector in an OEM Master Account. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

1. If the connector is not already shared, this action creates a new shared connector at the specified version.
2. If the connector is currently shared, this updates the version currently shared for this connector.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the custom connector in your Workspace to share. This must be a released version.

delete.summary: Remove sharing of the custom connector oem version
delete.description: Remove sharing of the custom connector oem version. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege. This does not delete the custom connector from your workspace. Please note that using this API whils there are customers accounts using this connector will impact their recipes.

post.description: The Release operation allows you to release the latest version of your custom connector. After you release the new version, it is used in all future jobs.

The Share operation allows you to share the most recently released version of your custom connector. After you share your custom connector, all workspaces that have installed your connector through a private link or from the community library receive an update notification.

get.summary: Search custom connector belonging to user by title
get.description: Search for custom connectors by their titles. Partial matches will also be returned.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title name to search for a custom connector

get.description: This endpoint allows you to fetch a custom connector's code
Lists all folders

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Parent folder ID. Defaults to Home folder.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the folders to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of folders to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

post.description: Creates a new folder in the specified parent folder. If no parent folder ID is specified, the folder created will be a top level folder (in the Home folder).

parent_id.description: Parent folder ID. Defaults to Home folder.

delete.description: Delete a folder within your workspace.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder you plan to delete

force.description: Set this parameter to true to delete a folder that is not empty. When true, the folder you specify using the folder_id parameter, and its contents (all recipes and connections) within the folder are deleted. If set to false, this action can only delete an empty folder.

get.description: Returns a list of properties belonging to a customer account that matches a prefix. For example, if the prefix provided is salesforce_sync., any account property with a name beginning with 'salesforce_sync.' will be returned. Depending on the presence of the project_id, it returns either environment properties or project properties.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Return properties with the given prefix. E.g: 'salesforce_sync.'

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: If provided, returns only the project properties associated with the specified project

200.description: Returns a hash containing key-value pairs of matching properties

post.description: Performs an upsert operation on properties. The properties are matched based on the names provided in the request.

properties.description: Hash containing the names and values of the properties to upsert

project_id.description: Project where properties should be upserted

post.description: Generates Workato schema from a stringified JSON sample

sample.description: Stringified JSON of the sample document to parse

post.description: Generates Workato schema from a stringified CSV sample

sample.description: Stringified CSV of the sample document to parse

col_sep.description: Column delimiter for the CSV sample. Must be one of the following: comma, semicolon, space, tab, colon, pipe.

custom_col_sep.description: Custom column delimiter for the CSV sample. If both 'col_sep' and 'custom_col_sep' are provided, 'col_sep' will be considered.

get.description: List all Developer API clients

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the API clients to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API clients to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

post.description: Create a Developer API client

all_folders.description: Flag indicating whether API client has access to all folders

folder_ids.description: Array of folder IDs. Required if all_folders is false.

environment_name.description: Name of the environment. Required if your workspace has environments enabled.

get.summary: Get a Developer API Client by ID
get.description: Get a Developer API client by ID

put.description: Update a Developer API client

all_folders.description: Flag indicating whether API client has access to all folders

folder_ids.description: Array of folder IDs. Required if all_folders is false.

environment_name.description: Name of the environment. Required if your workspace has environments enabled.

result.description: Always returns success upon successful deletion

post.summary: Regenerate a Developer API Client token
post.description: Regenerates the API token for an API client. This invalidates the previous API token.

get.description: Lists all API endpoints. Specify the api_collection_id to obtain the list of endpoints in a specific collection.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the API endpoints to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API endpoints to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

parameters.name: api_collection_id
parameters.description: ID of the API collection. If the parameter is not provided, all API endpoints are returned.

put.description: Enables an API endpoint. The underlying recipe must be started to enable the API endpoint successfully.
Disables an active API endpoint. The endpoint can no longer be called by a client.

get.description: Return all connections of current user

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Folder id where connections are stored.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Id of parent connection to get all children.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: External identifier given to the user who owns the runtime user connection.

parameters.name: include_runtime_connections
parameters.description: Flag to define either include or not runtime connections. Default: false

post.description:
Creates a new connection. This endpoint supports the following actions:

1. Create a shell connection, or
2. Create and authenticate a connection (not supported for OAuth type connections)

name.description: Connection name. Eg: 'Prod Salesforce connection' etc.

folder_id.description: Folder id where connection should be stored.

external_id.description: External identifier given to the user who owns the runtime user connection.

get.summary: List API client roles belonging to user

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Page size(defaults to 100. Max allowed is 100)

get.summary: List custom roles belonging to user
get.description: Return all custom roles of current user

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Page size(defaults to 100. Max allowed is 100)

post.summary: Make a copy of an existing role
post.description: Return the newly created role

folder_ids.description: Array of project folder ids to override. The source folder ids are copied as is when not provided

put.description: Update folders for role

all_folders.description: Tells if it's an all folders access. Possible values 'true'/'false'

get.description: List all API clients. This endpoint includes the project_id to which the API client belongs in the response.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the API clients to fetch. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of API clients to return in a single page. Defaults to 100. Max is 100.

post.description: Create a new API client within a project you specify

project_id.description: The ID of a specific project. Retrieve a list of project IDs by using the list projects endpoint.

get.summary: Returns paginated list of standard connectors ordered by name. Requires 'oem_vendor' privilege.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Page size (defaults to 100. Max allowed is 100)

awaiting_setup.description: True if agent is not configured

last_seen_version.description: Last known version of the On-prem agent

state_error.description: Error in the On-prem agent's state. Returns null if no error.

url.description: Base URL for the API collection

api_spec_url.description: URL for the OpenAPI specification of the API collection

project_id.description: ID of the project associated with this API collection. If null, the API collection has access across all projects.
ID of the project associated with this lookup table. Returns null, if the lookup table is accessible to all projects.

data.description: The hash containing the data for the row in the form of column_name:value pairs. For example, { "name": "United States", "code": "USA" }

api_client_id.description: ID of the API client to which this access profile belongs to

api_collection_ids.description: IDs of the API collections that are accessible by this access profile

active.description: Returns whether the access profile is disabled or enabled

auth_type.description: Authentication method used in the access profile. Returns one of token, jwt, oauth2 and oidc.

in_use.description: Indicates whether the On-prem group has any associated connections

use_managed_connection.description: Indicates whether the On-prem group supports cloud profiles

external_id.description: External ID of the Embedded customer

admin_notification_emails.description: Comma-separated list of admin notification emails

error_notification_emails.description: Comma-separated list of error notification emails

plan_id.description: ID of the plan assigned to this customer

origin_url.description: Origin URL where the embedded IFrame is hosted

trial.description: Indicates if the customer account is in trial

in_trial.description: Indicates if the customer account is in trial

frame_ancestors.description: Comma-separated list of frame ancestor URLs

task_limit_adjustment.description: Task limit adjustment for current accounting period. Only valid for task-based plans.

active_connection_limit.description: Maximum active connections allowed for this customer

active_connection_count.description: Number of active connections in the customer's workspace

active_recipe_count.description: Number of running recipes in the customer's workspace

trial.description: Indicates if the customer account is in trial

error.description: Error description if export operation failed

flow_id.description: ID of the API recipe associated with this endpoint

method.description: HTTP method used by the endpoint (GET, POST, etc.)

active.description: Indicates if the endpoint is active

legacy.description: Indicates if the endpoint is a legacy endpoint

folder_id.description: Related folder ID. Projects are essentially top-level folders.

project_id.description: ID of the project associated with this API client. If null, the API client has access across all projects.

latest_released_version.description: Custom connector latest released version number

latest_released_version_note.description: Custom connector latest released version note

latest_released_version.description: Custom connector latest released version number

oem_shared_version.description: Version number of the customer connector shared with OEM customers. Available only for OEM Admins

oem_shared_at.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Available only for OEM Admins

external_id.description: External identifier given to the user who owns the runtime user connection

folder_id.description: Id of folder where connection is stored

APIKey.description: Enter the token with the 'Bearer ' prefix, e.g. "Bearer abcde12345"
APIKey.name: Authorization
